verses.text: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool hath no joy.

Therefore the Lord shall have no joy in their young men, neither shall have mercy on their fatherless and widows; for every one of them is a hypocrite and an evildoer, and every mouth speaketh folly. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
And they sorrowed in their hearts, for they durst not speak unto him the thing which they desired.
For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words, of him shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he shall come in his own glory, and in his Father's, and of the holy angels.

verses.text: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.

similars.text: Thou shalt offer a sacrifice unto the Lord thy God in righteousness, even that of a broken heart and a contrite spirit.

verses.text: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.

similars.text: And for this cause I said that he is a wicked man, for he has sought to take away the things wherewith you have been entrusted; and he has also sought to destroy your gift.
Wherefore, a man being evil cannot do that which is good; neither will he give a good gift.
For behold, if a man being evil giveth a gift, he doeth it grudgingly; wherefore it is counted unto him the same as if he had retained the gift; wherefore he is counted evil before God.
For behold, God hath said a man being evil cannot do that which is good; for if he offereth a gift, or prayeth unto God, except he shall do it with real intent it profiteth him nothing.
And not as it was by one that sinned, so is the gift: for the judgment was by one to condemnation, but the free gift is of many offences unto justification.
And because you have delivered the writings into his hands, behold, wicked men have taken them from you.
Wo unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope;

verses.text: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.

similars.text: Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.

O that cunning plan of the evil one! O the vainness, and the frailties, and the foolishness of men! When they are learned they think they are wise, and they hearken not unto the counsel of God, for they set it aside, supposing they know of themselves, wherefore, their wisdom is foolishness and it profiteth them not. And they shall perish.
For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.
And their wisdom shall be great, and their understanding reach to heaven; and before them the wisdom of the wise shall perish, and the understanding of the prudent shall come to naught.

Now, behold this is wisdom; whoso readeth, let him understand and receive also;
Let him that is ignorant learn wisdom by humbling himself and calling upon the Lord his God, that his eyes may be opened that he may see, and his ears opened that he may hear;
For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye yourselves are wise.

verses.text: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bare him.

We believe that the commission of crime should be punished according to the nature of the offense; that murder, treason, robbery, theft, and the breach of the general peace, in all respects, should be punished according to their criminality and their tendency to evil among men, by the laws of that government in which the offense is committed; and for the public peace and tranquility all men should step forward and use their ability in bringing offenders against good laws to punishment.

Because the law worketh wrath: for where no law is, there is no transgression.

verses.text: He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.

similars.text: Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.

For what man knoweth the things of a man, save the spirit of man which is in him? even so the things of God knoweth no man, but the Spirit of God.

Therefore, whoso readeth it, let him understand, for the Spirit manifesteth truth;

That in every thing ye are enriched by him, in all utterance, and in all knowledge;

verses.text: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
